\chapter{Introduction}
\label{\detokenize{z01_intro:introduction}}\label{\detokenize{z01_intro::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This repository demonstrates how to use \sphinxstylestrong{Sphinx} for building documentation in two formats:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
A \sphinxstylestrong{multi\sphinxhyphen{}page} document intended for detailed documentation and printable PDFs.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
A \sphinxstylestrong{single\sphinxhyphen{}page} document designed for fast reference.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
You can build the documents in both \sphinxstylestrong{HTML} and \sphinxstylestrong{PDF} formats using the provided \sphinxtitleref{Makefile}.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This guide walks you through the setup, customization, and generation process.

\sphinxstepscope


\chapter{Usage}
\label{\detokenize{z02_usage:usage}}\label{\detokenize{z02_usage::doc}}

\section{Directory Structure}
\label{\detokenize{z02_usage:directory-structure}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The main components of this repo are:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxtitleref{multi\sphinxhyphen{}pgs\sphinxhyphen{}src/}: Contains reStructuredText files for the multi\sphinxhyphen{}page guide.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxtitleref{single\sphinxhyphen{}pg\sphinxhyphen{}src/}: Contains content for the one\sphinxhyphen{}page quick guide.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxtitleref{\_preamble/}: Custom LaTeX preambles and title pages.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxtitleref{\_figs/}: Logo assets used in the documentation.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxtitleref{\_fonts/}: Custom fonts (e.g., Montserrat) used for PDF output.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxtitleref{\_static/} and \sphinxtitleref{\_templates/}: CSS and HTML template overrides.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxtitleref{output\sphinxhyphen{}dir/}: Stores final output files.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxtitleref{Makefile}: Automates building guides.

\end{itemize}


\section{Build Commands}
\label{\detokenize{z02_usage:build-commands}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Set the appropriate environment variable and run the following commands:

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Multiple Pages Guide:}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+nb}{export}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nv}{BUILD\PYGZus{}MULTI\PYGZus{}PGS}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m}{1}
make\PYG{+w}{ }multi\PYGZhy{}pgs\PYGZhy{}html\PYG{+w}{         }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Generates multi\PYGZhy{}page HTML}
make\PYG{+w}{ }make\PYG{+w}{ }multi\PYGZhy{}pgs\PYGZhy{}pdf\PYG{+w}{     }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Generates multi\PYGZhy{}page PDF}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Single Page Guide:}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
make\PYG{+w}{ }single\PYGZhy{}pg\PYGZhy{}html\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Generates single\PYGZhy{}page HTML}
\PYG{+w}{ }make\PYG{+w}{ }single\PYGZhy{}pg\PYGZhy{}pdf\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Generates single\PYGZhy{}page PDF}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Cleanup Commands:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
make\PYG{+w}{ }clean\PYG{+w}{             }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Removes intermediate files}
make\PYG{+w}{ }clean\PYGZhy{}all\PYG{+w}{         }\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Removes all builds and outputs}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxstepscope


\chapter{Installing Sphinx and Tools}
\label{\detokenize{z03_installing_sphinx:installing-sphinx-and-tools}}\label{\detokenize{z03_installing_sphinx::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
To use this template, install the following dependencies:


\section{Python \& pip}
\label{\detokenize{z03_installing_sphinx:python-pip}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Make sure Python and pip are installed:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
python3\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}version
pip3\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}version
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Install Sphinx and extensions:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
pip\PYG{+w}{ }install\PYG{+w}{ }sphinx\PYG{+w}{ }sphinx\PYGZus{}rtd\PYGZus{}theme
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Optional (for PDF output using LaTeX):

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
sudo\PYG{+w}{ }apt\PYG{+w}{ }install\PYG{+w}{ }texlive\PYGZhy{}latex\PYGZhy{}base\PYG{+w}{ }texlive\PYGZhy{}latex\PYGZhy{}recommended\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}}
\PYG{+w}{                 }texlive\PYGZhy{}fonts\PYGZhy{}recommended\PYG{+w}{ }texlive\PYGZhy{}latex\PYGZhy{}extra\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}}
\PYG{+w}{                 }texlive\PYGZhy{}xetex\PYG{+w}{ }lualatex
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Youâ€™ll also need:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxtitleref{lualatex}: Required for rendering custom fonts and logos

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
A terminal that supports \sphinxtitleref{make} (or run equivalent commands manually)

\end{itemize}

\clearpage
